Package fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories

Variables for HIOA simulation models.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ConstrainedIncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI
    The interface ConstrainedIncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI defines the methods offered by a generator of constrained interpolation functions for functions defined over points, constrained by their known first derivative, and that can be incrementally extended by progressively adding new points at the end of the current domain.
    IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI
    The interface IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI defines the methods offered by a generator of interpolation functions for functions defined over points that can be incrementally extended by progressively adding new points at the end of the current domain.
    PolynomialI
    The interface PolynomialI declares the methods for classes polynomial functions.
    ValueHistoryFactoryI<Type>
    The interface ValueHistoryFactoryI declares the method to be called to create a value history from a factory.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConstrainedCubicSplineInterpolatorGenerator
    The class ConstrainedCubicSplineInterpolatorGenerator implements a constrained cubic spline interpolator generator using Kruger's equations to create a constrained order 3 polynomial.
    ConstrainedInterval
    The class ConstrainedInterval implements a real value interval where end points are constrained by known first derivatives, and which is used in the definition of piecewise functions.
    IncrementallyInterpolatedFunction
    The class IncrementallyInterpolatedFunction implements a piecewise defined functions over successive intervals where each piece is interpolated using an interpolator generator (creating an appropriate interpolating function for each) and which can be extended with new pieces at the end of its current domain by adding points.
    Interval
    The class Interval implements a real value interval used in the definition of piecewise functions.
    LeastSquaresInterpolatorGenerator
    The class LeastSquaresInterpolatorGenerator implements interpolators based on a least squares approach, producing polynomials of orders 1, 2 or 3 and able to manage a limited (in size) window of values.
    LinearInterpolatorGenerator
    The class LinearInterpolatorGenerator implements an order 1 polynomial interpolator.
    Piece
    The class Piece implements a piece in a piecewise-defined function; a piece is defined over an interval and is interpolated by a polynomial.
    PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory
    The class PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory implements a value history for which an inter/extrapolation function is computed to be used when evaluating the value at some given time.
    PiecewiseInterExtrapolatedValueHistory.HistoricDerivableValue
    The class HistoricDerivableValue implements a value that can be recorded in a value history that also has a first derivative.
    Polynomial1
    The class Polynomial1 implements a polynomial function of order 1 (linear).
    Polynomial2
    The class Polynomial2 implements a polynomial function of order 2 (quadratic).
    Polynomial3
    The class Polynomial3 implements a polynomial function of order 3 (cubic).
    ValueHistory<Type>
    The class ValueHistory implements a history mechanism for model variables to memorise its most recent values over a predefined time sliding window in a buffer.
    ValueHistory.HistoricValue<Type>
    The class HistoricValue implements a value that can be recorded in a value history.

Package fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories Description

Variables for HIOA simulation models.

This software is a computer program whose purpose is to provide a new implementation of the DEVS simulation de facto standard for Java.

Users are therefore encouraged to load and test the software's suitability as regards their requirements in conditions enabling the security of their systems and/or data to be ensured and, more generally, to use and operate it in the same conditions as regards security.

The fact that you are presently reading this means that you have had knowledge of the CeCILL-C license and that you accept its terms.

HIOA models have continuous exported, imported and internal variables which are actually signals i.e., variables which values change over time. This package defines classes used to implement histories of values for such variables. These histories keep old values within some time window and can be associated with an inter/extrapolation function allowing to better evaluate the value of the variable at time for which actual values are not known.
